poem:
Alfred's Note

Beyond the keys,  
a whisper hums—  
not accolades,  
but music's heart.  
Brendel, in grace,  
denies the throne,  
crafting echoes  
from sensibilities wide.  
Notes unfurl,  
not sufficient,  
but vast,  
like silent shadows  
dancing.  
In every pause,  
a world revealed—  
an ordinary man,  
ever extraordinary.
